SENT.plain: We report a case of a 77-year-old man with deteriorating dementia caused by repeated multiple small cerebral embolisms from a thoracic aortic atheroma
Multiple small embolisms were confirmed by diffusion-weighted magnetic resonance imaging (DWI)
The patient ultimately died due to aortic dissection
Pathological examinations revealed that no causative embolic source for multiple embolisms could be detected other than severe atheromatous ulcer in thoracic aorta
This case demonstrates that severe aortic atheroma has the potential to precipitate deterioration of vascular dementia
